Street View Image (SVI) Analysis

The SVI module provides tools for analyzing street view images, including feature extraction, semantic segmentation, and object detection.

Feature Extraction

Street View Image (SVI) feature extraction module.

This module provides functions for extracting various features from street view images, including: - Basic image features (color, edges, contrast, etc.) - Semantic segmentation using SegFormer - Object detection using Faster R-CNN - Scene recognition using ResNet

The module is designed to work with pandas DataFrames containing image filenames and returns DataFrames with added feature columns.

urbancode.svi.feature.filename(folder_path, output_filename=None, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Scan folder for image files and create a DataFrame with filenames.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • output_filename (str, optional) – CSV filename to save results

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name for the filename column. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

DataFrame with image filenames

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.color(df, folder_path=None, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Extract color features from images and add to DataFrame.

This function extracts various color-based features from images including: - Colorfulness - Hue statistics - Saturation statistics - Lightness statistics - Contrast - Sharpness - Entropy - Image variance

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added color feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.read_image_with_pil(image_path)[source]

Read an image file using PIL and convert it to OpenCV format.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file

Returns:

Image in BGR format (OpenCV format)

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If image cannot be read

urbancode.svi.feature.compute_colorfulness(image)[source]

Compute the colorfulness metric of an image.

This metric is based on the paper “Measuring colorfulness in natural images” by Hasler and Süsstrunk (2003).

Parameters:

image (numpy.ndarray) – Image in BGR format

Returns:

Colorfulness score

Return type:

float

urbancode.svi.feature.compute_canny_edges(image)[source]

Compute the ratio of edge pixels in an image using Canny edge detection.

Parameters:

image (numpy.ndarray) – Image in BGR format

Returns:

Ratio of edge pixels to total pixels

Return type:

float

Compute mean and standard deviation of hue channel in HSV color space.

Parameters:

Returns:

(mean hue, standard deviation of hue)

urbancode.svi.feature.extract_features(image_path)[source]

Extract all basic image features from a single image.

This is a helper function that combines all basic feature extraction functions into a single call.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file

Returns:

Dictionary containing all extracted features

Return type:

dict

urbancode.svi.feature.segmentation(df, folder_path, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Perform semantic segmentation on images using SegFormer model.

This function uses the SegFormer model fine-tuned on Cityscapes dataset to segment images into 19 different classes including road, building, vegetation, etc.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added segmentation feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.object_detection(df, folder_path, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Perform object detection on images using Faster R-CNN.

This function uses Faster R-CNN with ResNet-50 backbone pre-trained on COCO dataset to detect objects in images. It detects common urban objects like people, vehicles, traffic signs, etc.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added object detection feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.scene_recognition(df, folder_path=None, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Perform scene recognition on images using ResNet.

This function uses ResNet-50 pre-trained on ImageNet to classify images into different scene categories.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added scene recognition feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

The feature extraction module provides various functions for analyzing images:

  • filename: Scan a folder for image files and create a DataFrame with filenames

  • color: Extract color features from images

  • compute_colorfulness: Calculate the colorfulness of an image

  • compute_canny_edges: Detect edges in an image using Canny edge detection

  • compute_hue_mean_std: Calculate mean and standard deviation of hue

  • compute_saturation_mean_std: Calculate mean and standard deviation of saturation

  • compute_lightness_mean_std: Calculate mean and standard deviation of lightness

  • compute_contrast: Calculate image contrast

  • compute_sharpness: Calculate image sharpness

  • compute_entropy: Calculate image entropy

  • compute_image_variance: Calculate image variance

Semantic Segmentation

The segmentation module uses SegFormer for semantic segmentation of street view images.

Street View Image (SVI) feature extraction module.

This module provides functions for extracting various features from street view images, including: - Basic image features (color, edges, contrast, etc.) - Semantic segmentation using SegFormer - Object detection using Faster R-CNN - Scene recognition using ResNet

The module is designed to work with pandas DataFrames containing image filenames and returns DataFrames with added feature columns.

Perform semantic segmentation on images using SegFormer model.

This function uses the SegFormer model fine-tuned on Cityscapes dataset to segment images into 19 different classes including road, building, vegetation, etc.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added segmentation feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Perform object detection on images using Faster R-CNN.

This function uses Faster R-CNN with ResNet-50 backbone pre-trained on COCO dataset to detect objects in images. It detects common urban objects like people, vehicles, traffic signs, etc.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added object detection feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Perform scene recognition on images using ResNet.

pd.DataFrame

Object Detection

The object detection module uses Faster R-CNN for COCO object detection in street view images.

Street View Image (SVI) feature extraction module.

This module provides functions for extracting various features from street view images, including: - Basic image features (color, edges, contrast, etc.) - Semantic segmentation using SegFormer - Object detection using Faster R-CNN - Scene recognition using ResNet

The module is designed to work with pandas DataFrames containing image filenames and returns DataFrames with added feature columns.

Perform semantic segmentation on images using SegFormer model.

This function uses the SegFormer model fine-tuned on Cityscapes dataset to segment images into 19 different classes including road, building, vegetation, etc.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

Original DataFrame with added segmentation feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.object_detection(df, folder_path, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Perform object detection on images using Faster R-CNN.

This function uses Faster R-CNN with ResNet-50 backbone pre-trained on COCO dataset to detect objects in images. It detects common urban objects like people, vehicles, traffic signs, etc.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added object detection feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

urbancode.svi.feature.scene_recognition(df, folder_path=None, filename_column='Filename')[source]

Perform scene recognition on images using ResNet.

This function uses ResNet-50 pre-trained on ImageNet to classify images into different scene categories.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing image filenames

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • filename_column (str, optional) – Name of the column containing filenames. Defaults to ‘Filename’

Returns:

Original DataFrame with added scene recognition feature columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Examples

Here are some examples of using the SVI module:

from urbancode.svi import feature

# Extract features from a single image
features = feature.extract_features('path/to/image.jpg')

# Process a folder of images
df = feature.filename('path/to/folder')
df = feature.color(df)

# Perform semantic segmentation
segmentation = feature.segmentation('path/to/image.jpg')

# Detect objects
objects = feature.object_detection('path/to/image.jpg')
